clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Omega-3 FA on Hypertriglyceridemia in Patients With T2DM(OCEAN)
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Omega-3 Fatty Acids on Hypertriglyceridemia in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to conduct a multicenter randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial, evaluating the effects and change of lipid metabolism, especially of triglyceride after omega-3 administration in type 2 diabetes patients with hypertriglyceride.

detailed_description.textblock:
In the present study, about 350 type 2 diabetes patients with hypertriglyceride will be enrolled from multiple centers in China. Randomization was computer generated and stratified by center. After screening, eligible subjects will be randomly assigned into one of the following two groups: Omega-3 fatty acids capsules ( 2pills bid) and placebo capsules (2pills bid).
Blood, feces and urine samples will be collected before and after treatment. Triglycerides (TG), total cholesterol (TC), LDL-C, HDL-C, HbA1C, fasting plasma glucose (FPG), postprandial plasma glucose (PPG) will be measured. Blood metabolomics profiles of lipids, amino acids, bile acids, the change of gut microbiota, and pharmacogenomic components and parameters will be evaluated too.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in serum triglycerides from baseline
primary_outcome.description: With aid of autoanalyser, the investigators will measure the serum triglycerides in blood samples before and after treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in blood metabolomics profile of lipid species from baseline
primary_outcome.description: With aid of LC/MS and GC/MS, the investigators will measure blood metabolomics profile of lipid species before and after treatment. The metabolomics measurement will help to detect the profile of all kinds of lipids species. The composition change of all these biological molecular induced by the treatment is our major interest rather than single molecular quantification.
